name.en: Chair of Security and Theoretical Computer Science

structural_unit_name.en: Chair of Security and Theoretical Computer Science

description.en: The use of cryptographic libraries for encrypting files and communication, authentication methods, integrity protection, public key infrastructures, composition of secure protocols, secure methods for obtaining random bits, smartcards, digital signatures.
description.et: Levinud tarkvareteekide kasutamine failide ja muu andmeside krüpteerimiseks, autentimine, dokumentide võltsimiskindluse tagamine, avaliku võtme infrastruktuurid, turvaliste protokollide koostamine, juhubittide turvaline kogumine, kiipkaardid, digitaalsed allkirjastamisprotokollid.

objectives.en: Students taking the course will know how to correctly use cryptographic primitives like hash functions, signatures, symmetric and asymmetric encryption in practical software development.
objectives.et: Aine läbinud üliõpilased oskavad tarkvarasüsteemide arendamisel korrektselt kasutada krüptograafia primitiive nagu räsifunktsioonid, signatuurid, sümmeetrilised ja asümmeetrilised krüptosüsteemid.

learning_outcomes.en: Students will learn how to use popular programming tools to implement various cryptographic constructions. They get practical experiences how to employ cryptographic protocols and public key infrastructure for enforcing practical security goals.
learning_outcomes.et: Üliõpilane oskab kasutada levinud programmeerimisvahendeid erinevate krüptograafiliste konstruktsioonide realiseerimiseks. Üliõpilane omandab praktilise kogemuse, kuidas kasutada krüptograafilisi protokolle ja  avaliku võtme infrastruktuuri erinevate turvaeesmärkide saavutamiseks.

notes.et: e-learning: Moodle; lecture video recordings in Panopto; Zoom for practice sessions and the test.

independent_work.et: The instructions are given by lecturer

description.et: Home exercises will be given each week, requiring to implement some cryptographic functionality discussed at that week's lecture. The solutions usually must be submitted within a week.
The test consists of 70 open-ended questions that have to be answered in a concise manner.

grade_evaluation.et: The final grade will be determined by the home exercises (70%) and the test (30%).

debt_elimination.et: The test is optional and cannot be retaken. If a student fails to appear on the test and receives F for the course, the student can take the test in another semester when the course is given.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

name.en: Chair of Security and Theoretical Computer Science
Chair of Security and Theoretical Computer Science

description.et: Introduction, grading, homework submissions, academic fraud
Randomness, Pseudo-Random Number Generator (PRNG), Bitwise operations, One-Time Pad (OTP), Stream cipher
Abstract Syntax Notation One (ASN.1), ASN.1 standard data types and tagging, Distinguished Encoding Rules (DER) encoding

Cryptographic hash function and its properties, brute-force attack and security level, security of server-side password hashing, commitment scheme, hash-based PRNG, hash chain, hash tree (Merkle tree), Hash-based Message Authentication Code (HMAC)
Block ciphers, modes of operation (ECB, CBC, CTR, GCM), disk encryption, password-based encryption, password-based key derivation function (PBKDF2), side-channel attack

Public Key Cryptography, RSA key generation, RSA PKCS#1 v1.5 algorithm for encryption and signing, RSA public and private key storage format, hybrid encryption, exponentiation operation (square and multiply method), key length recommendations, adversary (threat) model, threshold cryptography, Smart-ID threshold scheme
Diffie-Hellmann (DH) key exchange, Elliptic curve (EC) cryptography, EC point operations, Elliptic-curve Diffie-Hellmann (ECDH), Elliptic-curve Digital Signature Algorithm (ECDSA)

Public Key Infrastructure (PKI), Public Key Certificates (X.509), Certificate Authority, Identity verification (Domain Validation, Organization Validation, Extended Validation), Certificate Transparency, Certificate Signing Request (CSR)

Certificate Revocation List (CRL), CRL data structure, Online Certificate Status Protocol (OCSP), structure of OCSP request and response, OCSP response freshness checking (nonce mechanism), revocation checking in browsers, HTTP protocol, sockets in Python

eIDAS Regulation, Qualified Electronic Signature (QES), Qualified Electronic Signature Creation Device (QSCD), Validation of QES, Trusted timestamping, Digital signature container, XML Advanced Electronic Signatures (XAdES)

Smart cards, smart card communication using Application Protocol Data Units (APDU), smart card file system, SELECT FILE command, Answer To Reset (ATR), transmission protocols (T=0/T=1), electrical communication, Estonian electronic identity card (EstEID), communication with smart card using Python, digital signing using browser extension, authentication using browser extension (Web eID), Biometric ePassport (eMRTD), communication over NFC

Smart card security model, Estonian ID card, Payment cards (EMV), Mobile phone SIM cards, Pay TV, attacks against smart cards, Common Criteria (CC) security certification, JavaCard, JavaCard applet, GlobalPlatform standard for applet management, memory management in JavaCard, JavaCard applet development under Eclipse
Transport Layer Security (TLS), TLS handshake, TLS session resumption, TLS record layer, TLS messages, TLS encryption and MAC process, TLS key derivation
TLS Client Certificate Authentication, Renegotiation, TLS and Perfect Forward Secrecy (PFS), TLS extensions, TLS v1.3 overview
Tor, onion routing, traffic correlation attack, malicious Tor nodes, deanonymization attacks, Tor Onion Services, TorChat instant messenger, TorChat protocol, server sockets in Python
Bitcoin, Bitcoin transactions, Proof-of-work system, blockchain, Bitcoin's peer-to-peer network, anonymity, security assumptions and functional requirements
